00040 typedef struct _KviKvsObjectConnection
00041 {
00042         KviKvsObject * pSourceObject;    // source object (owner of the struct)
00043         KviKvsObject * pTargetObject;    // target object
00044         QString        szSignal;         // source signal name
00045         QString        szSlot;           // target slot function
00046 } KviKvsObjectConnection;
00047 
00048 typedef KviPointerList<KviKvsObjectConnection> KviKvsObjectConnectionList;
00049 typedef KviPointerListIterator<KviKvsObjectConnection> KviKvsObjectConnectionListIterator;

00051 class KVIRC_API KviKvsObject : public QObject
00052 {
00053         friend class KviKvsObjectController;
00054         friend class KviKvsObjectClass;
00055         Q_OBJECT
00056 public:
00057         KviKvsObject(KviKvsObjectClass * pClass,KviKvsObject * pParent,const QString &szName);
00058         virtual ~KviKvsObject();
00059 protected:
00060         // main data
00061         QString                                      m_szName;             // object name
00062         kvs_hobject_t                                m_hObject;            // global object handle
00063         KviKvsObjectClass                          * m_pClass;             // the class definition
00064 
00065         KviKvsHash                                 * m_pDataContainer;     // member variables
00066 
00067         KviPointerList<KviKvsObject>                   * m_pChildList;
00068 
00069         KviPointerHashTable<QString,KviKvsObjectFunctionHandler>         * m_pFunctionHandlers;  // our function handlers
00070 
00071         KviPointerHashTable<QString,KviKvsObjectConnectionList>          * m_pSignalDict;        // our signals connected to other object functions
00072 
00073         KviKvsObjectConnectionList                 * m_pConnectionList;    // signals connected to this object functions
00074 
00075         // this is valid when processing one of our slots
00076         kvs_hobject_t                                m_hSignalSender;
00077         QString                                      m_szSignalName;
00078 
00079         // if this object wraps a qt one, it is here
00080         QObject                                    * m_pObject;
00081         bool                                         m_bObjectOwner;       // do we have to destroy it ?
00082 
00083         // We're going to die soon after the control is given back to the event loop
00084         bool m_bInDelayedDeath;
00085         // We're going to die BEFORE the control is given back to the event loop
00086         bool m_bAboutToDie;
00087         // Did we already call the destructor ?
00088         bool m_bDestructorCalled;
00089 public:
00090         kvs_hobject_t handle(){ return m_hObject; };
00091 
00092         // the wrapped Qt object (may be 0!)
00093         QObject * object() const { return m_pObject; };
00094         void setObject(QObject * o,bool bIsOwned = true);
00095 
00096         const QString & getName(){ return m_szName; };
00097 
00098         KviKvsObject * parentObject(){ return (KviKvsObject *)parent(); };
00099         QWidget * parentScriptWidget();
00100 
00101         bool connectSignal(const QString &sigName,KviKvsObject * target,const QString &slotName);
00102         bool disconnectSignal(const QString &sigName,KviKvsObjectConnection * con);
00103         bool disconnectSignal(const QString &sigName,KviKvsObject * target,const QString & slotName);
00104 
00105         // Emits a signal by calling all the attacched slots in an unspecified order.
00106         // Returns the number of slots called (may be 0, if no slot is connected)
00107         // The parameters are preserved.
00108         // this is intended to be called from other function calls (the parameters are copied from pOuterCall)
00109         // since we should NEVER emit totally spontaneous signals: all of them
00110         // should be generated inside object functions (either from scripting or by core calls)
00111         int emitSignal(const QString &sigName,KviKvsObjectFunctionCall * pOuterCall,KviKvsVariantList * pParams = 0);
00112 
00113         void setSignalSender(kvs_hobject_t hObject){ m_hSignalSender = hObject; };
00114         kvs_hobject_t signalSender(){ return m_hSignalSender; };
00115         void setSignalName(const QString &szSigName){ m_szSignalName = szSigName; };
00116 
00117         KviPointerHashTable<QString,KviKvsObjectFunctionHandler> * functionHandlers(){ return m_pFunctionHandlers; };
00118 
00119         KviKvsHash * dataContainer(){ return m_pDataContainer; };

00122         bool dieNow();

00127         bool inheritsClass(const QString &szClass);

00129         KviKvsObjectFunctionHandler * lookupFunctionHandler(const QString & funcName,const QString & classOverride = QString());
00130 
00131         // Registers a private implementation of a function
00132         // The function may or may not be already registered in the class
00133         // If szCode is empty the the private implementation is removed instead
00134         void registerPrivateImplementation(const QString &szFunctionName,const QString &szCode);
00135 
00136         // ONLY pCaller can be zero here!
00137         // please use one of the wrappers, if possible
00138         bool callFunction(
00139                 KviKvsObject * pCaller,          // calling object, can be zero (used for the "internal" access list verification)
00140                 const QString & fncName,         // name of the function to call
00141                 const QString & classOverride,   // eventual class override for the functon call, may be QString()
00142                 KviKvsRunTimeContext * pContext, // calling runtime context (you'll have problems with instantiating this... :P )
00143                 KviKvsVariant * pRetVal,         // the return value
00144                 KviKvsVariantList * pParams);    // the parameters for the call
00145         // a nice and simple wrapper: it accepts a parameter list only (eventually 0)

00147         // this one gets a non null ret val too
00148         bool callFunction(KviKvsObject * pCaller,const QString &fncName,KviKvsVariant * pRetVal,KviKvsVariantList * pParams = 0);

00154         bool unregisterConnection(KviKvsObjectConnection * con);

00159         void unregisterChild(KviKvsObject *c);
